result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$2500-$5000], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary.

Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment, at least until all financial obligations are paid.
Defendant can apply in writing for expunction upon successful completion of probation and all conditions.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through Petition of Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 150 hours of uncompensated community service for a non-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb L Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for 1 year to pay restitution and Court-ordered financial obligations

Defendant Caleb L Smith in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State advises that significant restitution has been made, but not all of it. Court questions Defendant, who wants to proceed without Counsel. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Court reviews charge on Information, max. penalties, elements. Defendant waives reading of Information. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Caleb L Smith in court.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on meeting with DA. Defendant wants to accept offer. State advises of offer made to Defendant, does not know how much time Defendnat may need to pay restitution up front. Court reviews process for Defendant, questions Defendant on whether he wants to speak with an attorney due to felony conviction. Defendant is prepared to enter plea. State advises Court that Defendant would have to waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, who is prepared to proceed today. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.
No contact direct or indirect with JN or McDonald's. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Caleb L Smith in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
